articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Slams Ulji Freedom Guardian
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK Foreign Ministry Slams Ulji Freedom Guardian

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Wednesday issued the following statement denouncing the U.S. and the south Korean authorities for kicking off the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises:
					
					The United States and the south Korean authorities kicked off extremely provocative and aggressive Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises targeted against the DPRK despite the repeated warnings of the DPRK.
					
					This saber-rattling started by the U.S. in collusion with the south Korean authorities is maneuvers for a nuclear war against the DPRK which brought to light their invariable hostile aim to stifle it by force of arms.
					
					This is entailing such adverse consequences as vitiating the atmosphere of dialogue created with much effort in reflection of the unanimous desire and wishes of the people at home and abroad for peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and straining the situation.
					
					The U.S. is staging exercises for a war of aggression against its dialogue partner while putting up signboard of dialogue. This incoherent behavior on the part of the U.S. is only adding to the skepticism about whether it is sincere towards dialogue or not.
					
					It is preposterous for the U.S. to urge the DPRK to refrain from bolstering its nuclear deterrent, while whetting its swords for a war of aggression behind the scene of dialogue.
					
					It is very ill-boding that the U.S. let "a special action unit" participate in the on-going joint military exercises as it is one tasked to detect and destroy nuclear weapons of the DPRK.
					
					The prevailing situation goes to prove that the U.S. is not set to realize the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations but seize an opportunity to deprive it of nuclear deterrent by a brigandish method.
					
					It is self-evident that the DPRK should put spurs to bolstering its nuclear deterrent for self-defence both in quality and quantity to cope with this situation.
					
					Invariable is the stand of the DPRK to preserve peace and denuclearize the peninsula through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					No attempt on the part of the U.S. to do harm to the DPRK by force of arms can go with dialogue. This will only face the mode of merciless counteraction of Korean-style.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Outgoing Norwegian Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Outgoing Norwegian Ambassador

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday met and had a talk with Didrik Tonseth, Norwegian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell visit to him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Indonesian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Indonesian Ambassador Hosts Reception

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Nasri Gustaman, Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception on Wednesday on the 66th anniversary of independence of Indonesia. 
					
					Invited to the reception were Pak Ui Chun, DPRK foreign minister; Pak Kun Gwang, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea; Pak Kil Yon, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs; Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Association, and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					Staff members of the Indonesian embassy attended the reception. 
					
					Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Shooter Crowned with Three Gold Medals
articles.content:
Shooter Crowned with Three Gold Medals

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Ri Hyang Sun, a DPRK woman shooter, won the 25m rapid-fire pistol event of the 5th World Military Games held in Brazil on July 23.
					
					Ri scored 577 points despite unfavorable weather condition.
					
					She also made a big contribution to the DPRK team winning the 25m sports pistol and 25m rapid-fire pistol events held on July 19 and 22. Therefore, she bagged three gold medals in the games.
					
					The girl took gold medals in the 10m air pistol event of the 10th Asian Shooting Championship in 2004 and 25m rapid-fire pistol team event of the 4th World Military Games in 2007.
					
					Ri told KCNA that she wanted to make good results in the games to live up to the expectation of Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Pine-nut Trees in Panmunjom
articles.content:
Pine-nut Trees in Panmunjom

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A historic pan-national rally for the peace and reunification of Korea was held in the northern portion of Panmunjom on August 15, Juche 79 (1990).
					
					The rally, the first of its kind since the division of the country 45 years ago, was attended by Koreans from the north and south of Korea and abroad.
					
					After the rally, they set up a monument and planted pine-nut trees around the venue in token of the nation's ardent desire for the country's reunification.

articles.title: Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower
articles.content:
Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Ten years have passed since the Three Charters for National Reunification Memorial Tower was erected in Pyongyang. 
					
					The memorial tower was unveiled on August 14, Juche 90 (2001), a day before the 56th anniversary of the country's liberation from the Japanese colonial rule. 
					
					Thenceforth, more than 900 000 people have visited the tower.
					
					Some 15 500 of them are overseas Koreans and foreigners belonging to nearly 3 000 groups. 
					
					The arch-style memorial tower covers over 100 000 square meters, with its platform embossed with group sculptures. 
					
					The tower is 30 meters high and 61.5 meters wide, symbolizing the three charters for national reunification and the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					The tower portrays two women in Korean dress holding up the emblem of the three charters.
					
					The tower's weight, 7 000 tonnes, mirrors the strong will of the 70 million Koreans to pool efforts and reunify the country. 
					
					Standing near the tower is a monument containing President       Kim Il Sung's proposition. 
					
					On display there are some 820 stone pieces presented by state and party leaders and prominent figures of other countries, and south and overseas Koreans. 
					
					When the tower was unveiled, the stone pieces numbered 740. 
					
					Many pro-reunification events, including a grand festival for national reunification in 2001, took place there.

articles.title: New Wind Power Generator Made in Korea
articles.content:
New Wind Power Generator Made in Korea

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A new wind power generator has been introduced in different areas of the DPRK as part of the effort for making use of renewable energy.  
					
					The generator, made in the DPRK, is high in economic effectiveness. 
					
					The sweep designed to stand strong wind is 1.2 times longer than the existing one in the serviceable life. 
					
					The stator is fixed in a rational way to reduce consumption of copper.
					
					The new wind power generator has already found itself in the west coastal areas of the country, including Jungsan and Phyongwon counties, South Phyongan Province and Onchon County, Nampho City. 
					
					It is also finding its way to highlands and east coastal areas of the country.

articles.title: Korea's Magic Art Comes Long Way
articles.content:
Korea's Magic Art Comes Long Way

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A Pyongyang magic group recently made a performance tour of Chinese cities.
					
					Chinese acrobats and spectators highly appreciated the performance for its admirable ideological and artistic attributes.
					
					In Korea magic is regarded as art of merit helping people cultivate creative ability and promote intellectual development.
					
					Korea's magic art has changed just from hoodwinking to a popular art giving people pleasure and encouraging them to make great achievements in their work.
					
					Kim Chol, vice-chairman of the Magicians Association of Korea, told KCNA that the association has steadily renewed and diversified the magic performance.
					
					Typical of the magic pieces are Apple Harvest, Our Flourishing Life, Silk Fabrics Pour Out and Drum Sound.
					
					A large-scale magic performance took place at May Day Stadium in Pyongyang a few months ago, demonstrating the rapid development of Korea's magic art.
					
					The performance, including several pieces, admired the spectators.
					
					Korea's magic pieces won top prizes at the 16th International Modern Magic Festival and other festivals.

articles.title: Secondary School Famous for Training Reserve Artistes
articles.content:
Secondary School Famous for Training Reserve Artistes

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KNCA) -- The newly created drama "We Will Recollect Today", a winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, has been performed in Pyongyang, enjoying a great popularity among Korean people.
					
					One of the leading characters is Jon Ju Ok, a 14-year-old girl. She plays the part of the heroine's daughter.
					
					Jon studied in a class of training film actors and actresses at Pyongyang Tonghung Secondary School. 
					
					Teachers who graduated from Pyongyang University of Dramatic and Cinematic Arts are in charge of the class. Some of them starred in movies and TV dramas.
					
					Many graduates from the school are now active in feature film studios and famous art troupes.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Ulji Freedom Guardian
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts Ulji Freedom Guardian

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces kicked off provocative Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises for aggression despite repeated warnings of the DPRK and strong protest and denunciation of the public at home and abroad.
					
					This is a reckless action contrary to the expectation and desire of the Korean and other world people aspiring after denuclearization and peace of the Korean Peninsula and an extremely dangerous action to ignite a new war.
					
					They claim that the exercises are "annual" and aim to "cope with threat." But this is no more than sheer sophism intended to cover up their aggressive nature.
					
					Involved in this saber-rattling are more than 30 000 troops of the U.S. forces and at least 56 000 troops of the puppet forces, 530 000 in all, and modern war hardware including sophisticated nuclear strike means. The theatre of these war maneuvers covers vast areas linking the Korean Peninsula with Pacific and the U.S. mainland. This clearly proves the danger of the saber-rattling. 
					
					It is also proved by the fact that a drill for eliminating someone's WMDs will be conducted under the simulated conditions of an actual war while the military exercises are under way, pursuant to the new scenario for a war against the DPRK.
					
					This military provocation perpetrated by them in utter disregard of the concern of the international community over the escalating tension on the peninsula and the region goes to prove that the U.S. is the arch criminal harassing peace and standing in the way of the process for the denuclearization of the peninsula.
					
					The reality goes to clearly prove that it is impossible to defuse the military confrontation and danger of war on the peninsula nor is it possible to realize its denuclearization as long as the U.S. vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK and the south Korean conservative authorities' moves to escalate the confrontation with it are allowed to persist.
					
					It is the steadfast stand of the DPRK government to realize the denuclearization on the peninsula.
					
					The denuclearization can never be realized by the efforts of one party alone. This must be a comprehensive and fair one as it should include defusing the danger of war and nuclear threat to the DPRK.
					
					The denuclearization of the peninsula can never go with war maneuvers.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK still remain unchanged in their will and stand to take toughest counteraction against the test nuclear war and preliminary war aimed to mount a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Urges Japan to Behave Itself
articles.content:
KCNA Raps Japan's Perverted Way of Thinking

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- 66 years have passed since the Second World War ended. 
					
					Many countries and nations on the globe have striven hard to check the revival of militarism and fascism, recollecting the horrible war disasters every year.
					
					However, it is only in Japan where abnormal phenomena take place in an unbroken chain quite contrary to this international trend to stun the international community. 
					
					The behaviors of politicians of Japan who hold official positions on August 15, day of Japan's defeat, provide a glimpse of the reality in the Japanese society prevalent with the trend of denying its past. 
					
					At least 50 Dietmen belonging to the "Association of Dietmen for Visiting Yasukuni Shrine" swarmed to the shrine on the day. Yoshihiko Noda, minister of Finance, openly said A Class war criminals entombed in the shrine were not war criminals. 
					
					When the prime minister and ministers avoided the visit to the shrine, Governor of Tokyo Metropolis Ishihara, ultra-right maniac, did not hesitate to let loose such hysteric remarks as "those guys are not Japanese."
					
					This open and blatant denial of history by Japanese politicians on the day of disgrace makes the international community express concern over the ultra-right political trend prevailing in the Japanese society as it is one going beyond the scope of behaviors of individual ultra nationalists. 
					
					Japan has emerged a dangerous force of aggression keen on overseas expansion and militarism and is swayed with ultra-right social trend, oblivious of its past.
					
					The present reality of Japan reminds one of its appearance before its defeat when it advocated "the whole world under one roof" and "the Greater East Asia Co-prosperity Sphere." 
					
					The reckless behaviors of ultra-right politicians on August 15 alone glaringly show the dirty political landscape in Japan where militarists, ultra-right conservative forces and descendants of war criminals ride roughshod, holding power. 
					
					The future of Japan cannot but remain dismal as long as the above-said ultra-right elements are allowed to run wild. 
					
					The Japanese reactionaries are now treading the same road of destruction as what the Japanese militarists did in the past.

articles.title: Actions for Democratization Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions for Democratization Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Council of Bereaved Families for the Nation and Democracy held a ceremony in Seoul on August 12 to mark its 25th anniversary.
					
					At the ceremony speakers referred to the fact that the organization has struggled for social democracy.
					
					Grievous deaths are still repeated themselves due to the authorities, they deplored.
					
					In order to hold in check continued violence and death it is necessary to judge the present unpopular and anti-reunification regime, they held.
					
					They said that the organization would take the lead in the dynamic struggle for realizing democratization.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Roll Back Their Policy of Confrontation with DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Roll Back Their Policy of Confrontation with DPRK

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Peasants across south Korea held an August 15 meeting of peasants for independent reunification outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan in Seoul on August 14.
					
					Present there were peasants affiliated with the Federation of Peasants Associations, the Federation of Women Peasants Associations and other peasants associations in Kyonggi, North and South Chungchong, North and South Kyongsang, North and South Jolla and south Korean Kangwon provinces, Jeju Island and other areas.
					
					In a resolution the participants said: The present regime's hostile policy toward the north is depriving us of everything and covering the Korean Peninsula with dark clouds of tension and war. Tears of warm excitement shed by Koreans in the south and the north faded away and the dear promise made by them turned out to be a waste paper. The authorities are incriminating even the expression of patriotism.
					
					They demanded the authorities roll back their policy of confrontation, holding they should opt for defusing the tensions between the south and the north and achieving reconciliation and peace, though belatedly.

articles.title: Action for Judging S. Korean Puppet Regime Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Action for Judging S. Korean Puppet Regime Declared in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- More than 3 000 workers of south Korea held a rally in the Seoul City Office plaza on August 14 at which they declared the action to judge the puppet regime.
					
					At the rally speakers said the most urgent task at present is to judge the anti-reunification, undemocratic and anti-worker present regime and the "Grand National Party".
					
					The inter-Korean relations have reached the lowest ebb and the workers calling for their vital rights have been harshly suppressed since the present regime emerged, they charged.
					
					In order to tide over this grave situation it is necessary to overthrow the present regime and realize democracy, they held.
					
					It is impossible to think about peace without judging the dictatorial regime seeking the permanent division of the nation, they said. They called upon all the workers to boost solidarity and turn out in the massive action to force the present ruling forces to step down.

articles.title: Massive Anti-U.S. Rally Held in Seoul
articles.content:
Massive Anti-U.S. Rally Held in Seoul

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A rally denouncing the U.S. forces' environmental pollution and joint war maneuvers took place outside the U.S. military base in Ryongsan in Seoul on August 14. It was sponsored by the preparatory committee for "The Meeting of People for Building New Society" of south Korea.
					
					At least 10 000 Seoul citizens attended.
					
					Ri Kyu Jae, chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, Yun Hui Suk, joint representative of the south Korean Youth Solidarity, and others made speeches.
					
					The people in the south have suffered distress for the past 66 years, subject to plunder and pressure by the U.S. forces, they deplored.
					
					It has been disclosed in succession that the U.S. forces in south Korea buried massive toxic substances including defoliant in the areas where they were stationed, they said. This is an issue concerning sovereignty, not merely an issue related to environment.
					
					They said they cannot tolerate the present "government" conniving at the U.S. forces' crimes, while staying silent on the issue.
					
					The U.S. forces should be pulled back from south Korea at once and all the DPRK-targeted joint military exercises be stopped, they urged.
					
					Then they encircled the base and launched a protest action, pasting posters reading "U.S. forces, withdraw from south Korea" on the wall of the base.

articles.title: Judgment of Treacherous Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Judgment of Treacherous Regime Called for in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A rally in Youido, Seoul on August 14 called for judging the treacherous regime and realizing independent and peaceful reunification of the Korean Peninsula. It was sponsored by the south Korean Committee for Promoting the August 15 Meeting for Independent Reunification.
					
					More than 15 000 people from all walks of life including members of opposition parties, workers, peasants, youth and students, women and the poor attended the rally.
					
					The speakers said that the authorities are cracking down on the forces protesting against their policy for confrontation with the DPRK and unpopular rule on the strength of the fascist law. This prompted the enraged people to rise up in actions in different parts, they added.
					
					They called for judging the present regime and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification by pooling their efforts and implementing the inter-Korean joint declarations.
					
					A letter from Rev. Han Sang Ryol, a reunification champion, who is being kept behind bars, was read out at the rally.
					
					The letter said that the inter-Korean joint declarations are a key to realizing the people's hope. 
					
					Prior to the rally, different events were held in various parts of Youido. They included a youth rally for peace and reunification, an event of women for reunification, a students' cultural meeting for independent reunification, the August 15 rally of the poor for reunification and a rally of the Democratic Labor Party for vowing to achieve independent reunification.

articles.title: S. Korean Opposition Party Condemns Misrule of "Government"
articles.content:
S. Korean Opposition Party Condemns Misrule of "Government"

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The representative of the Democratic Party of south Korea, Son Hak Gyu, Tuesday accused the "government" of inviting a ruling crisis, south Korea's MBC reported.
					
					In a radio address, he said the chief executive's silence about Japan's distortion of history textbooks resulted in Japan's row over Tok Islets.
					
					The present financial crisis is due to the economic policy based on construction projects and conglomerates, he added.
					
					He also urged the "government" to reshape foreign and economic policies.

articles.title: Eye Disease Patients Increase Rapidly in S. Korea
articles.content:
Eye Disease Patients Increase Rapidly in S. Korea

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- An increasing number of people are suffering from eye troubles in south Korea, said a media report.  
					
					According to a survey of medical institutions throughout south Korea, those afflicted with eye diseases from July 31 to August 6 jumped 25 percent compared with a week ago. Particularly, those suffering from acute hemorrhagic conjunctivitis increased 12 percent.

articles.title: Japan LDP Dietmen's Attempt to Visit Ullung Island Criticized
articles.content:
Japan LDP Dietmen's Attempt to Visit Ullung Island Criticized

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- A dietman from the Social- Democratic Party of Japan criticized the imprudent attempt of the Dietmen from the Liberal Democratic Party to visit Ullung Island as part of its moves to seize Tok Islets, according to CBS of south Korea Monday.
					
					He said it brought about a serious result as it was only a stage business to heighten their popularity.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal released an information bulletin "Warm congratulations to the heroic Korean people on the 66th anniversary of the auspicious national liberation" on August 11.
					
					The bulletin said in an article that President Kim Il Sung brought about the liberation of Korea on August 15, 1945, overcoming all difficulties amid snowstorms in Mt. Paektu.
					
					It continued:
					
					All Koreans in the north and the south and overseas deeply revere him as lodestar of national liberation.
					
					Korea's liberation from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule instilled confidence into the people in colonial countries struggling for achieving national liberation and inspired the world progressive people in their struggle.
					
					The heroic Korean people are now dynamically advancing to build a prosperous and powerful state and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the Songun leadership of Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					The Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Committee of Nepal joins the world progressives in celebrating the historic day of Korea's liberation and extends invariable support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Russia, Nigeria
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in Russia, Nigeria

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Russian and Nigerian papers carried special write-ups on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The Russian newspaper Patriot No. 30 carried a picture of President Kim Il Sung making a historic speech upon his triumphant return home at a Pyongyang city mass rally and an article titled "Century of Liberation".
					
					The article said:
					
					Kim Il Sung founded the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army after clarifying that an armed struggle was the only way for achieving national liberation and united anti-Japanese patriotic forces by forming the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland. 
					
					The traditions of victory which began in Mt. Paektu are given steady continuity thanks to the Songun politics.
					
					The paper is illustrated by a photo showing a panoramic view of Pyongyang City.
					
					The Nigerian paper Nigerian Observer on August 10 carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung: genius of guerrilla war methods."
					
					Noting that Korean liberation was the victory of superb guerrilla war methods created by Kim Il Sung, a legendary guerrilla commander, the paper said he set forth a lot of guerrilla war methods during the anti-Japanese armed struggle. By dint of such superb war methods the Japanese imperialists' "combing tactics", "Patience wears out stones" and "tactics of long-distance pursuit" and other tactics were frustrated, it said.
					
					The Pochonbo Battle clearly proved the above-said superb war methods, the paper noted, adding that the exploits the President performed by winning one victory after another in many battles fought during the great anti-Japanese war and accomplishing the historic cause of national liberation would shine long in the world history of the national liberation struggle in colonies.

articles.title: Djakarta Declaration on Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung Adopted
articles.content:
ACNC denuncia la locura de los ultraderechistas japoneses

					Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Han transcurrido 66 anos desde el fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					Numerosos paises y naciones del mundo recuerdan cada ano desde aquel entonces los desastres dejados por tal guerra mundial y se empenan para evitar el renacimiento del militarismo y el fascismo.
					
					Pero, solo en Japon surgen los fenomenos anormales opuestos a tal corriente internacional pasmando a la sociedad internacional.
					
					el 15 de agosto, dia de derrota, a traves del movimiento de los politicos oficiales japoneses, todo el mundo puede saber una parte de la realidad social japonesa opuesta a su pasado.
					
					Ese dia, mas de 50 parlamentarios pertenecientes al "encuentro de parlamentarios que visitan todos al Santuario Yasukuni" acudieron a este santuario en colectivo.
					
					Por otra parte, el ministro de Finanzas, Yoshihiko Noda, dijo abiertamente que los criminales de guerra de la clase A sepultados en este santuario no son criminales de guerra.
					
					El fanatico gobernador ultraderechista de Tokio, Ishihara, en relacion con que el premier y otros ministros japoneses no visitaron el santuario, senalo sin titubeo que "estos tipejos no son japoneses".
					
					La sociedad internacional se preocupa de la tendencia politica ultraderechista que reina en la sociedad japonesa superando a los ultranacionalistas individuales ante el hecho de que los politicos japoneses libran oficialmente en el dia de derrota los actos opuestos a la historia.
					
					Ahora, Japon ha aparecido como una fuerza agresiva peligrosa aspirante a expansion a ultramar y la militarizacion olvidando su pasado criminal y alli reina la tendencia social ultraderechista.
					
					Tal realidad de Japon nos recuerda el aspecto de Japon en visperas de la derrota que gritaba "todo el mundo bajo un techo", la "Esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental".
					
					La locura de los politicos ultraderechistas japoneses perpetrada el dia 15, muestra claramente la naturaleza militarista y el aspecto politico de Japon donde tras tomar el poder actuan con frenesi los conservadores ultraderechistas y los descendientes de los criminales de guerra.
					
					Cuanto mas ellos se desesperan para incitar a la guerra y poner al reves la corriente de la historia, tanto mas sera oscuro el futuro del pais isleno. 
					
					El camino optado hoy por los reaccionarios japoneses es el de derrota, tomado por el militarismo japones en el pasado.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised at Regional Seminar
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung Praised at Regional Seminar

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- An Asia-Pacific regional Internet seminar on immortal exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung for global independence took place in Indonesia on August 3 and 4. 
					
					The seminar brought together chiefs of Juche idea study organizations and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and political and public figures from Asia-Pacific  countries including Cambodia, Myanmar, Mongolia, Indonesia, Philippines, Pakistan, Thailand, Nepal, Bangladesh, Australia, New Zealand and Japan and teachers and students of Bungkarno University of Indonesia.  
					
					An opening speech was made by the secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia. Then introduced were messages of greeting to the seminar by representatives of the international preparatory committee and different regional preparatory committees for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung and the director-general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					
					The general chairperson of the Indonesian Party said in a keynote report that the world is vast and human history is long, but they do not know such great man as Kim Il Sung who performed so immortal exploits after embarking on the road of revolution at his early age. 
					
					Kim Il Sung's exploits, unprecedented in their contents, depth, sphere and influence on the development of times and history, will last forever, he stressed.
					
					The idea and cause of the President have been successfully carried forward by leader Kim Jong Il in the DPRK, he noted, expressing the belief that the cause of global independence is sure to be accomplished thanks to Kim Jong Il.
					
					Then the floor was taken by the honorary chairman of the Philippine Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung, the secretary general of the Nepali National Committee for Remembering the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung, the chairman of the Cambodia-Korea Friendship Association, the chairman of the Bangladesh People's League, the chairman of the Thai Organization for the Study of Juche Idea and an advisor to the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Association and other personages. The speakers lauded Kim Il Sung as a prominent leader and the sun of the 20th century, underscoring the need to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of the President as the greatest holiday common to humankind.
					
					A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted there.
					
					The letter said that the exploits performed by the President in the annals of the past century serve as the most precious treasure of humankind and a source of boundless strength encouraging the world progressive people in the era of independence to win victories.
					
					The Jakarta declaration on the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Praised by Foreign Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Praised by Foreign Political Party

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Benin-Baanitee made public a statement on August 10 on the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					The statement said that his Songun revolutionary leadership made it possible for socialist Korea to steadily advance, winning one victory after another, adding that the Korean People's Army could grow to be invincible armed forces thanks to the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					It was thanks to the Songun politics that the Korean people could protect the independent dignity and lay a foundation for achieving the reunification of the country, it noted.
					
					Recalling that various countries and nations are subject to humiliation and trampled down by foreign aggressor forces as they are not strong in their defence capabilities, the statement stressed that the reality in the world today goes to prove that the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il is the best in the world.
					
					The statement extended firm support and solidarity to the Korean people dynamically promoting the cause of building a prosperous and powerful state under the uplifted banner of Songun, united close around Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korea's DPRK-targeted War Exercises Slammed
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korea's DPRK-targeted War Exercises Slammed

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification made public a statement on Aug. 13 to denounce the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers for their war exercises against the DPRK.
					
					The statement said that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are set to stage joint military exercises Ulji Freedom Guardian from August 16 to 26 with war equipment and huge forces involved.
					
					The war exercises to be staged according to "OPLAN 5027", a plan for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK, will screw up the military tension, the statement said.
					
					The warmongers seek to stage exercises for a total war despite their lip-service for dialogue, creating an atmosphere of confrontation with the DPRK again, it charged.
					
					It called upon all the compatriots aspiring after peace and reunification to pool their efforts to smash the warmongers' moves for confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: CSTO Secretary Calls for Battling Cyber Terrorism
articles.content:
CSTO Secretary Calls for Battling Cyber Terrorism

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The secretary of the Collective Security Treaty Organization (CSTO), Nikolai Borzhzya, Monday called for intensifying the battle against cyber terrorism.
					
					Cyber terrorism threat has become a serious and main problem as the IT-based attack renders the situation of countries instable, the secretary said. Taking countermeasures to cope with the threat is one of the CSTO's primary tasks. 
					
					CSTO will launch a systematic effort for battling cyber terrorism, he added.

articles.title: China Cooperates with Fiji, Bolivia
articles.content:
China Cooperates with Fiji, Bolivia

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- China and Fiji on August 12 agreed to boost bilateral relations of cooperation in the fields of politics, economy, culture and education.
					
					On the same day China and Bolivia agreed to boost mutual cooperation in the economic, trade, cultural and other fields.

articles.title: China Ready for All-round Cooperation with Bolivia: President
articles.content:
China Ready for All-round Cooperation with Bolivia: President

					Beijing, August 16 (KCNA) -- Chinese President Hu Jintao Friday called for expanding cooperation with Bolivia.
					
					At a meeting with the visiting Bolivian President Ebo Morales in Shenzhen City, Guangdong Province, Hu said bilateral friendly and cooperative relations have steadily developed thanks to joint efforts of the two countries.
					
					China is ready to continue joint efforts with Bolivia for all-round cooperation and happiness of the two countries' people, he added.
					
					The Bolivian president visited Shenzhen to participate in the opening ceremony of the 26th Universiad.

articles.title: China Releases Programs for Women, Children
articles.content:
China Releases Programs for Women, Children

					Beijing, August 16 (KCNA) -- The Chinese State Council recently released 2011-2020 programs on development of women and children, calling on bodies at all levels to creditably implement them.
					
					The programs comprise five parts -- guidelines and principles; general goals; development domains, major targets and strategic measures; arrangements; supervision and evaluation.

articles.title: China Takes Measures to Develop Stockbreeding Areas
articles.content:
China Takes Measures to Develop Stockbreeding Areas

					Beijing, August 16 (KCNA) -- The Chinese State Council released some recommendations for a rapid and proper development of stockbreeding areas.
					
					The recommendations call for adhering to the principle of giving priority to ecology while organically combining production with ecology, taking more effective measures and ensuring a rapid and healthy economic and social development in stockbreeding areas of the country.

articles.title: China Launches Campaign for Preventing Traffic Accidents
articles.content:
China Launches Campaign for Preventing Traffic Accidents

					Beijing, August 16 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Public Security launched on August 2 the supervision and inspection of implementation of measures for eliminating traffic accident factors and preventing accidents.
					
					The campaign continues by the end of September.

articles.title: Job Cut Plan Announced in U.S.
articles.content:
Job Cut Plan Announced in U.S.

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Postal Service (USPS) on August 11 announced the plan to lay off thousands of jobs to relieve from financial burden.
					
					According to it, USPS will cut as many as 120 000 jobs.

articles.title: Japan Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for War Crimes
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Make Apology and Reparation for War Crimes

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Japan should learn a lesson from the disgraceful defeat of the Japanese imperialists, drop the hostile policy toward the DPRK and make earlier apology and reparation for the crimes it committed against the Korean nation in the past, said Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article.
					
					Japan, far from making sincere admittance, apology and reparation for the hideous crimes against humankind, is adding fresh crimes to those already committed against the Korean people, the article said.
					
					It elaborated on the crimes Japan has committed against the Korean people since its defeat including the evasion of the redress for the past, campaign against the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and sanctions against the DPRK.
					
					The article went on:
					
					Japan's evermore undisguised moves to grab Tok Islets are a prelude to the reinvasion of Korea.
					
					By putting into practice its scenario to stage a comeback to Korea, Japan seeks to retrieve from its failed hostile policy toward the DPRK and evade the redress for its past to the last.
					
					Japan is gravely mistaken, however.
					
					The Japanese imperialists' defeat proved that the reckless militarist war hysteria could never save the destiny of Japan.
					
					Liquidation of the past is a bounden and urgent duty of Japan in light of legal, moral and historical points of view.
					
					This is the only way for Japan to lead a free life, away from the fate of a criminal state.

articles.title: Fukushima People Protest over Nuclear Crisis
articles.content:
Fukushima People Protest over Nuclear Crisisements

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- About 2 500 people including farmers and fishermen who are suffering heavy losses amid the nuclear crisis at the Fukushima Daiichi Power Plant marched in Tokyo on August 12.
					
					They protested against the government and TEPCO for taking no steps though they caused the nuclear disasters and brought fabulous losses to them. They called for prompt redress from plant operator Tokyo Electric Power Co. and the government.

articles.title: Sasebo Mayor Urges Govt. to Dispose of Nuke Waste at U.S. Navy Base
articles.content:
Sasebo Mayor Urges Govt. to Dispose of Nuke Waste at U.S. Navy Base

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- The mayor of Sasebo, which hosts a U.S. Navy base, urged the central government Friday to swiftly dispose of low-level radioactive waste found to have been stored at the military facility, which was gathered during the U.S. forces' relief operations after the March 11 earthquake-tsunami disaster in northeastern Japan.
					
					Sasebo Mayor Norio Tomonaga told reporters that he protested at the central government's failure to notify the city on the storage of the nuclear waste at the Navy base.

articles.title: Japanese Politicians' Group Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Flayed
articles.content:
Japanese Politicians' Group Visit to Yasukuni Shrine Flayed

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Japanese right-wing politicians paid group visit to the Yasukuni Shrine Monday.
					
					More than 50 Dietmen belonging to the "Association of Dietmen for visiting 'Yasukuni Shrine'" flocked to the shrine, inciting militarism.
					
					Tokyo Metropolitan Governor Ishihara was among the visitors.
					
					The visit, part of Japanese politicians' scenario to call back the departed soul of the militarists and realize the foolish ambition for reinvasion, is inviting the denunciation and derision of the international community.

articles.title: Japanese Finance Minister's Remarks Eulogizing War Criminals Slammed
articles.content:
Japanese Finance Minister's Remarks Eulogizing War Criminals Slammed

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Japanese Finance Minister Noda said the top war criminals whose mortuary tablets are kept in the Yasukuni Shrine are not war criminals.
					
					This nonsensical remark made in a news briefing Monday has touched off the great indignation of the international community.
					
					He uttered the similar rubbish in 2005.

articles.title: Japanese Diet Disapproves "Comfort Women" Bill
articles.content:
Japanese Diet Disapproves "Comfort Women" Bill

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Haruko Yoshikawa, an ex-member of Japan's House of Councilors, Saturday revealed that the Diet turned down eight times a bill for a solution to the "comfort women" issue.
					
					Speaking at an international conference, Yoshikawa said the bill had been brought to the Diet from 2001 only to be rejected.
					
					In Japan some people try to adopt history books with no mention about the "comfort women" issue but activities have been invigorated to check the adoption and let children know the truth, she added.

articles.title: Russia Turns Down U.S. Call for MD Cooperation
articles.content:
Russia Turns Down U.S. Call for MD Cooperation

					Moscow, August 16 (KCNA) -- A vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia Friday clarified his government's position of opposing the U.S. call for cooperation in the establishment of a missile defense (MD) system.
					
					The U.S. has called for cooperation in the MD project, failing to provide any guarantee that it will not weaken Russia's nuclear deterrent but ensure the security of the country, he said.
					
					Russia will never cooperate with the U.S., leaving its own interests hurt, he added.

articles.title: Russia to Increase Satellites
articles.content:
Russia to Increase Satellites

					Moscow, August 16 (KCNA) -- The general director of the Russian Federal Space General Bureau recently unveiled the country's plan of space development.
					
					Speaking to reporters, he said the space general bureau will supplement its satellite group with those of socio-economic missions and double the number of satellites before 2015.

articles.title: Moderate Quake Hits Sulawesi, Indonesia
articles.content:
Moderate Quake Hits Sulawesi, Indonesia

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.1 on the Richter scale struck off North Sulawesi in central parts of Indonesia on Friday.
					
					The quake jolted at 16:27 p.m. Jakarta time (0927 GMT) with epicenter at 183 km southeast Melonguane of North Sulawesi.

articles.title: Turkey Condemns Israeli Decision for Construction of New Jewish Settlements
articles.content:
Turkey Condemns Israeli Decision for Construction of New Jewish Settlements

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- Turkish Foreign Ministry in a statement on Friday condemned the Israeli moves to expand Jewish settlements.
					
					Recently the Israeli authorities announced the plans in succession to build new Jewish dwelling houses in east Kuds. The statement labeled it a violation of international law.
					
					Israel aims to change historical, geographical, cultural and religious tissue of east Kuds, the statement said.

articles.title: Cholera Cases on Increase in Somalia
articles.content:
Cholera Cases on Increase in Somalia

					Pyongyang, August 17 (KCNA) -- More than 1 640 acute watery diarrhea cases, a symptom that could result from cholera, have been registered in Somalia since June, according to data available on August 12.
					
					Mogadishu suffered biggest damage, a press report said.
					
					Steps are being taken to prevent cholera from spreading.

articles.title: Iranians Protest against UK Police Crackdown
articles.content:
Iranians Protest against UK Police Crackdown

					Tehran, August 16 (KCNA) -- Many Iranian students staged a protest in Tehran on Sunday against the British police's harsh crackdown on demonstrators.
					
					They gathered in front of the UK embassy to condemn the brutality and urge the British police to stop use of violence against demonstrators.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX rechaza "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX rechaza "Ulji Freedom Guardian"

					Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que Estados Unidos y las autoridades surcoreanas despliegan los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian", el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 17 la siguiente declaracion:
					
					Pese a nuestra reiterada advertencia, EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas iniciaron por fin los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" de caracter muy provocativo y agresivo contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					
					Esta maniobra de guerra nuclear demuestra claramente el invariable sentimiento hostil de atropellar a la RPDC con las fuerzas armadas. 
					
					Como consecuencia, se rompe el clima de dialogo dificilmente preparado en contrasentido a la unanime aspiracion y demanda de los nacionales y extranjeros, que desean la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana, y se empeora mas la situacion. 
					
					La dualidad de EE.UU., que por una parte, presenta el cartel de dialogo, y por la otra, desarrolla los ejercicios belicos contra la contraparte de dialogo, hace sospechar mas de su sinceridad ante el dialogo. 
					
					Es muy absurdo que ellos demanden a la RPDC dejar de fortalecer el disuasivo nuclear necesario para frenar la guerra, afilando detras de la cortina de dialogo el sable de la guerra de agresion.
					
					En particular, resulta muy sospechosa la participacion en dicha maniobra de la "unidad de accion especial" que tiene la mision de detectar y destruir las armas nucleares de la RPDC. 
					
					La situacion dada demuestra que EE.UU. no desea la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo y negociaciones, sino acecha la oportunidad de despojar como bandido el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC. 
					
					Es natural que demos mas impulso a la consolidacion cualitativa y cuantitativa de nuestro disuasivo nuclear de autodefensa para hacer frente a la situacion creada. 
					
					Es invariable la posicion de la RPDC de defender la paz y realizar la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana mediante el dialogo y negociaciones. 
					
					Pero, cualquier intencion de atentarnos con la fuerza sera incompatible con el dialogo y se enfrentara con el implacable modo de respuesta a nuestro estilo.

articles.title: Direccion surena de la APRP condena "Ulji Freedom Guardian"
articles.content:
Direccion surena de la APRP condena "Ulji Freedom Guardian"

					Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- La Direccion surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria (APRP) hizo publica el dia 13 una declaracion condenando los ejercicios militares conjuntos de Estados Unidos y los belicistas titeres del Sur de Corea.
					
					La nota se refirio a que EE.UU. y las autoridades surcoreanas planean librar del dia 16 al 26 los ejercicios militares conjuntos "Ulji Freedom Guardian" movilizando los equipos de guerra y a un gran numero de efectivos.
					
					Prosiguio que se agravara mas la tension militar durante esa maniobra a iniciarse segun el "OPLAN 5027", plan de ataque preventivo contra la RPDC.
					
					Condeno que aunque los belicistas hablan de dialogo de cara a cara, crean a las espaldas el clima de confrontacion anti-RPDC planeando los ejercicios de guerra total contra ella.
					
					Todos los coreanos, que deseen la reunificacion pacifica, deben frustrar rotundamente con sus fuerzas unidas la campana conflictiva anti-RPDC de los maniacos de guerra, subrayo.

articles.title: ACNC denuncia la locura de los ultraderechistas japoneses
articles.content:
ACNC denuncia la locura de los ultraderechistas japoneses

					Pyongyang, 17 de agosto (ACNC) -- Han transcurrido 66 anos desde el fin de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.
					
					Numerosos paises y naciones del mundo recuerdan cada ano desde aquel entonces los desastres dejados por tal guerra mundial y se empenan para evitar el renacimiento del militarismo y el fascismo.
					
					Pero, solo en Japon surgen los fenomenos anormales opuestos a tal corriente internacional pasmando a la sociedad internacional.
					
					el 15 de agosto, dia de derrota, a traves del movimiento de los politicos oficiales japoneses, todo el mundo puede saber una parte de la realidad social japonesa opuesta a su pasado.
					
					Ese dia, mas de 50 parlamentarios pertenecientes al "encuentro de parlamentarios que visitan todos al Santuario Yasukuni" acudieron a este santuario en colectivo.
					
					Por otra parte, el ministro de Finanzas, Yoshihiko Noda, dijo abiertamente que los criminales de guerra de la clase A sepultados en este santuario no son criminales de guerra.
					
					El fanatico gobernador ultraderechista de Tokio, Ishihara, en relacion con que el premier y otros ministros japoneses no visitaron el santuario, senalo sin titubeo que "estos tipejos no son japoneses".
					
					La sociedad internacional se preocupa de la tendencia politica ultraderechista que reina en la sociedad japonesa superando a los ultranacionalistas individuales ante el hecho de que los politicos japoneses libran oficialmente en el dia de derrota los actos opuestos a la historia.
					
					Ahora, Japon ha aparecido como una fuerza agresiva peligrosa aspirante a expansion a ultramar y la militarizacion olvidando su pasado criminal y alli reina la tendencia social ultraderechista.
					
					Tal realidad de Japon nos recuerda el aspecto de Japon en visperas de la derrota que gritaba "todo el mundo bajo un techo", la "Esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia Oriental".
					
					La locura de los politicos ultraderechistas japoneses perpetrada el dia 15, muestra claramente la naturaleza militarista y el aspecto politico de Japon donde tras tomar el poder actuan con frenesi los conservadores ultraderechistas y los descendientes de los criminales de guerra.
					
					Cuanto mas ellos se desesperan para incitar a la guerra y poner al reves la corriente de la historia, tanto mas sera oscuro el futuro del pais isleno. 
					
					El camino optado hoy por los reaccionarios japoneses es el de derrota, tomado por el militarismo japones en el pasado.
